title: Add config file support
description:
Add a configuration file for customizing the TUI.

**Note:** Project will be renamed first - update paths accordingly.

## Potential config location
- `~/.config/<new-name>/config.toml`

## Config options to consider
- Layout settings (TMUX_LAYOUT, TMUX_LAYOUTS_DIR)
- Colors/theme customization
- Keybindings
- Claude status enable/disable
- Default behaviors
close_reason: Implemented config file support with tsm init command

title: Fix and improve layout script support
description:
Layout script functionality needs investigation and improvement.

## Current state
- Layout applied via config: `layout` and `layout_dir` options
- Scripts at `~/.config/tmux/layouts/<name>.sh` executed on new session creation
- Fire-and-forget execution in goroutine

## Issues to investigate
- Verify layout scripts are actually being executed
- Check if environment variables are passed correctly
- Error handling is silent (no feedback if script fails)

## Potential improvements
- Add feedback when layout is applied
- Log errors if script not found or fails
- Consider timeout for layout script execution

title: Replace text scroll indicators with visual scrollbar
description: The current '↑ N more' and '↓ N more' text indicators take up vertical space and look clunky. Replace with a minimal scrollbar on the right side of the content area. This would: 1) Save vertical space for more content, 2) Provide better visual feedback of scroll position, 3) Look cleaner and more modern.
close_reason: Replaced text scroll indicators with visual scrollbar on left side of content

title: Code quality review and refactoring pass
description: After the initial implementation push, do a comprehensive code quality review. Look for: dead code, inconsistent patterns, opportunities to simplify, better naming, extract shared logic, improve error handling, and general cleanup. The codebase is functional - now make it clean.

title: Move repository to Black Atom Industries organization
description: Transfer this repository from nikbrunner to the Black Atom Industries GitHub organization. Update any references, remotes, and documentation accordingly.

title: Add fuzzy filter and remap keybindings behind Ctrl
description:
Rework keybindings to enable fuzzy filtering by typing letters directly.

## Current → New keybindings
- `j/k` → `Ctrl+j/k` (or arrows for navigation)
- `h/l` → `Ctrl+h/l` (or arrows for expand/collapse)
- `c` → `Ctrl+n` (create new session)
- `x` → `Ctrl+x` (kill)
- `y/n` confirmation → `Ctrl+y` to confirm, `Esc` to cancel

## New behavior
- Typing letters filters the session list (fuzzy match)
- `Esc` clears filter (or quits if no filter)
- `q` or `Ctrl+c` quits
- Number keys `1-9` still jump to sessions
- `Enter` selects filtered result

## Benefits
- Faster session switching with many sessions
- More intuitive vim-like feel (always-on search)

title: Add padding and border around the whole app
description:
Add consistent padding (one cell) around the entire TUI application and a border to frame it. This improves visual appearance and readability by preventing content from touching the terminal edges.

**IMPORTANT**: Adding padding and borders introduces extra cells that affect the overall layout dimensions. The config settings (window size, column widths, etc.) must be reviewed and potentially adjusted to account for these additional cells. Test thoroughly with different terminal sizes.

title: Add linting and formatting
description: Set up proper linting and formatting tooling for the Go codebase. Consider golangci-lint for linting and gofmt/goimports for formatting. Add to Makefile targets and consider pre-commit hooks or CI integration.

title: Change kill confirmation from C-y to double C-x
description: Currently kill confirmation requires pressing C-y after C-x. Change this so pressing C-x twice confirms the kill instead - more intuitive 'double-tap to confirm' pattern that keeps the action on the same key.
close_reason: Double C-x now confirms kill instead of C-y

title: Bubbletea TUI Rewrite
description: Rewrite tmux-session-picker from bash/fzf to Go/Bubbletea TUI. See docs/plans/2025-01-04-bubbletea-tui-design.md for full design.
close_reason: Bubbletea TUI rewrite completed and merged to main

title: Initialize Go module and project structure
description: Set up go.mod, create directory structure (cmd/tsp, internal/model, internal/tmux, internal/claude, internal/ui), add bubbletea/lipgloss/bubbles dependencies.

title: Implement switch action (enter)
description: Add enter key to switch to selected session or window. Call tmux switch-client. Exit TUI after switch.

title: Add transient message system
description: Implement message line with auto-clear after ~2 seconds. Show feedback after actions (switched, killed, created). Show errors in different color.

title: Create Makefile and install script
description: Add Makefile with build, install, clean targets. Binary name: tsp. Install location: ~/.local/bin/. Update install.sh to build Go binary instead of symlinking bash script.

title: Implement tmux command wrappers
description: Create internal/tmux/tmux.go with functions: ListSessions(), ListWindows(session), KillSession(name), KillWindow(session, index), CreateSession(name, dir), SwitchClient(target). Handle parsing tmux output.

title: Implement Claude status reader
description: Create internal/claude/status.go to read ~/.cache/tmux-session-picker/*.status files. Parse state (new/working/waiting) and timestamp. Handle missing files gracefully.

title: Create base model and view structure
description: Implement internal/model/model.go with App struct, Mode enum, Session/Window types. Set up basic bubbletea Init/Update/View lifecycle. Render static list without interactions.

title: Implement lipgloss styles
description: Create internal/ui/styles.go with styles for: selected row, normal row, expanded indicator, collapsed indicator, window row, Claude status colors (new/working/waiting), header, footer, message line.

title: Implement navigation (j/k/h/l)
description: Add key handling for j/k navigation through flattened list, h to collapse, l to expand. Handle cursor bounds. Auto-collapse other sessions when expanding.

title: Implement number jump (1-9)
description: Add 1-9 key handling. When in normal view, jump to session by position. When inside expanded session, switch directly to window. Handle edge case of >9 sessions.

title: Implement kill flow (x/xx)
description: Add kill functionality: single x shows confirmation in message line, double xx kills instantly. Handle ModeConfirmKill state. Re-fetch sessions after kill. Show feedback message.

title: Implement create session flow (c)
description: Add create functionality: c opens text input in message line, enter creates session and applies layout, esc cancels. Use bubbles textinput component. Validate session name.

title: Extend tsm init to auto-configure Claude hooks via jq
description: Extend the existing 'tsm init' subcommand to auto-configure Claude hooks in ~/.claude/settings.json using jq. Investigate if jq can reliably merge hooks without overwriting existing config. Should handle: file doesn't exist, file exists but no hooks key, file exists with existing hooks (merge without overwriting). First step: check feasibility of jq approach.

title: Use ANSI 16 colors for terminal theme compatibility
description:
Switch from hardcoded 256-color codes to ANSI 16 base colors (0-15) so tsm respects the user's terminal theme.

## Current
Hardcoded 256-color indices in styles.go:
- ColorPrimary = 212 (fixed pink/blue)
- ColorSecondary = 241 (fixed gray)
- etc.

## Goal
Use ANSI 16 colors that adapt to terminal theme:
- 0-7: normal colors (black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white)
- 8-15: bright variants

## Mapping ideas
- Primary → bright blue (12) or bright cyan (14)
- Secondary → bright black (8) or white (7)
- Success → green (2) or bright green (10)
- Warning → yellow (3) or bright yellow (11)
- Error → red (1) or bright red (9)
- Dim → bright black (8)

## Benefits
- Integrates with user's terminal colorscheme
- Consistent look with other terminal apps
- Works well with light and dark themes

title: Refactor repos_path from string to array of strings
description:
Change the `repos_path` config option from a single string to an array of strings. This allows users to specify multiple repository directories as entry points for session creation.

Example config change:
```toml
# Before
repos_path = "~/repos"

# After
repos_paths = ["~/repos", "~/work", "~/personal"]
```

Consider backwards compatibility - either support both formats or provide a clear migration path.

title: Fix selection highlight lost when scrolling without filter
description: When navigating up/down in the directory picker (without typing a filter query), the selection highlight color disappears when scrolling past the visible area. The highlighted item seems to get 'stuck' at the scroll indicator position instead of following the actual cursor. Likely a bug in how repoCursor vs repoScrollOffset are handled during render.
close_reason: Fixed by creating shared repoMaxVisibleItems() helper to ensure scroll offset calculation matches View's dynamic height logic

title: Fix directory picker header missing on initial render
description: When pressing C-o to open directory picker: 1) Header 'Select directory' is missing until you start typing a filter, 2) Footer shows HelpFiltering text instead of HelpPickDirectory. The header and top border appear once you type. Possibly a render timing issue or state not being cleared properly.
close_reason: Fixed by dynamically limiting content based on window height to prevent overflow clipping

title: Add directory picker for new sessions
description:
Add directory picker for creating new sessions from repository directories.

## Current State
The bubbles/filepicker approach doesn't work well - shows raw filesystem info and only one item at a time.

## Required UX (like `repos open`)
- Shows flat list of all directories under `repos_dir` 
- Format: `owner/repo` (e.g., `nikbrunner/tsm`)
- Fuzzy filtering as you type
- Enter selects and creates session

## Implementation

### Config additions
```toml
repos_dir = "~/repos"    # Base directory to scan
repos_depth = 2          # Scan depth (default: 2 for owner/repo structure)
```

### How `repos` does it (line 321)
```bash
find "$REPOS_BASE_PATH" -mindepth 2 -maxdepth 2 -type d | sed "s|$REPOS_BASE_PATH/||" | sort
```

### New approach
1. **Remove bubbles/filepicker** - not suitable for this UX
2. **Create custom directory list** - scan directories at startup of picker mode
3. **Reuse existing list/filter logic** - same fuzzy matching as session list
4. **Display format**: `owner/repo` (relative path from repos_dir)
5. **On select**: Create session named `owner-repo`, starting in that directory

### Model changes
- Replace `filepicker.Model` with `repoDirs []string` (scanned directories)
- Add `repoFilter string` for filtering
- Add `repoCursor int` for selection
- `scanRepoDirectories()` function using `os.ReadDir` recursively

### Key binding
- `C-o` opens repo picker (unchanged)

### Session naming
Convert `owner/repo` to session name: `owner-repo` (replace `/` with `-`)

title: Pick a new project name
description:
The project needs a new name now that it's a Go TUI instead of a bash/fzf script.

## Considerations
- Short and memorable
- Available on GitHub
- Reflects tmux session management
- Binary name should be easy to type

## Current names
- Repo: tmux-session-picker
- Binary: tsp

## Ideas to explore
- Keep `tsp` as binary name?
- Something with "switch", "hop", "jump"?
